How to Install netatalk-dbg on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • netatalk-dbg

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install netatalk-dbg on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing netatalk-dbg on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall netatalk-dbg in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install netatalk-dbg, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install netatalk-dbg Using apt

To install netatalk-dbg in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install netatalk-dbg using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install netatalk-dbg

The installation of netatalk-dbg might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install netatalk-dbg Using apt-get

To install netatalk-dbg using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install netatalk-dbg.

sudo apt-get -y install netatalk-dbg

Install netatalk-dbg Using Synaptic

To install netatalk-dbg using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install netatalk-dbg on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for netatalk-dbg. This will display the netatalk-dbg package in the package window, now to install netatalk-dbg, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the netatalk-dbg package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of netatalk-dbg.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install netatalk-dbg Using aptitude

To install netatalk-dbg on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of netatalk-dbg.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install netatalk-dbg using the command aptitude install netatalk-dbg.

sudo aptitude -y install netatalk-dbg

How to Upgrade netatalk-dbg on debian

If you want to upgrade the netatalk-dbg package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade netatalk-dbg using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade netatalk-dbg to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade netatalk-dbg.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade netatalk-dbg sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade netatalk-dbg

Upgrade netatalk-dbg using Aptitude

To upgrade netatalk-dbg using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade netatalk-dbg.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade netatalk-dbg

Upgrade netatalk-dbg using Synaptic

To upgrade netatalk-dbg using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for netatalk-dbg, now right-click netatalk-dbg, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade netatalk-dbg just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall netatalk-dbg on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall netatalk-dbg from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just netatalk-dbg, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove netatalk-dbg

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of netatalk-dbg

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of netatalk-dbg you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge netatalk-dbg

Remove netatalk-dbg using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall netatalk-dbg using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for netatalk-dbg, right-click the netatalk-dbg package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall netatalk-dbg click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install netatalk-dbg on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade netatalk-dbg using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of netatalk-dbg then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
